title: What's your standard of banning an account? You really ban the people ruining this game?
body:
I have played this game 5 years, and it also brings me much fun. I play this game for having fun, for relaxing,  like most people, not getting myself mad. I know that there are many  troll this game. That kind of people always do bad in this game, but they  like to blame someone to abreact their unhappiness. I rarely speak in this game except necessary communication for assist, even my teammates do really bad as long they are not intentional( coz everyone does bad sometimes).  However, I got banned in one game, I was jg, I got invaded, mid was killed by  opposite solely. He began to blame me, began to troll, I tolerate his first two two sentences, but such people would never let u go. I returned fire. Then I got banned.

I want to ask here, I got banned, a man always tolerate and rarely speak , those troll and keeping blaming are still active,  is this your way to do things, roit
? Just judge by machine, by who got more number of report? What if they play in double, triple, quad? Troll team?

trolls play in triple and quad, after they troll someone they want to blame, then they report that guy who will be banned, is this your way, justified way to do things?

well, if this game treat me in an unfair way, i got to abandon it of course.
I got banned because of troll, that's funny and irony, this is how society works, bad guys always live better than guys following rules.
bye, 5 years, but it's indeed a pity I will leave with bad memory about this game.

replies.body:
After playing with only one incident since ~2009 (got a chat ban in ~2015-16 - cant remember the year) I got an automated 14 dayer and some bad attitude from player behaviour who agreed that the ban was definitely out of context but upheld the suspension.

Quit for 3 months. Came back for a few weeks but the fun has gone for me so I have recently uninstalled again. 

Might come back one day. Might not. But either way, the change in customer care and player support since about August last year has really lowered my opinion of the game and some of the people behind it. And the shift to loot boxes after being such a fantastic model of FTP done SOO SO right for nearly a decade was a very sad day. Used to jump at the chance to throw money at this game but with the change of delivery model towards something that is known to be exploitative has really turned me off. Greed is not good - ever since the founders handed the reigns over to accountants looking for a return on their investment, the heart has been ripped out of LoL for me.

I'll try to keep it simple because the punishment system can be a lot to understand.

Number of reports does not matter, only validity. Reports trigger a review of the behaviour in that game, not the punishment, so a false report does nothing.

You being punished, does not mean that they weren't. There is a notification to tell you if your report has contributed to a punishment, but it's unreliable and very limited in when it shows, so not seeing it doesn't mean noone was punished.

Chat is a lot easier to punish on a large scale than in game behaviour is. To automation, negative chat (of the generic variety) is a lot easier to interpret than behaviour that could be intent feeding, or just someone having a really bad game, could be trolling, or could just be someone who has no idea what they're doing. What this means is that while both behaviours are punished, chat is punished in a more appropriate amount of time, where in game behaviour can take a lot longer to be detected and actioned. It's not great, but it is what it is.

It doesn't matter who started it. You are judged on your own behaviour. If someone was toxic to you, it sucks, but you being toxic back makes you just as bad as them. I don't know what specifically applies here, but if you want community feedback on your punishment, it's always recommended you post your chat logs.

What kind of ban did you receive? Typically a first punishment is a 10 game chat restriction, which is in essence a warning that your behaviour is starting to cross the line. If you were escalated straight to a 14 day ban, it's usually because hate speech/suicide encouragement or some in game offence was involved. If you've had punishments in the past then your previous reform cards would have told you that continued negative behaviour would escalate your punishments.

I personally think that because of speech on a person can make the punishment but the permanent ban is too much, we have freedom of speech and speech is a way we published personal emotion is a kind of communication, negative speech is negative people in an expression of power. LOL is considered as the two aspects of game and competition. It needs communication and communication between teams, but not everyone in the world is reasonable, and not all players understand how to play this game. A high-level player must have the desire to win, but because the matching mechanism problems will inevitably encounter many bad games, his teammates might have some problems. The excesses of speech come from the game, if you need to find a root to the who the wrong reasons, but also from the game to review, for the fist, only through language to ban a person's account is a very simple and indiscreet way to deal with problems.
You said that no matter who started it only judged on the individual behavior, which itself is an excuse to avoid deeper scrutiny. Everything has both positive and negative affect. The honor system is a good start, but this setting can't compete against the negative effects caused by the report. There are a lot of reasons, not every teammate will give honor to those players who deserved an honor. So considering all these factors, I want to say is to ban an account only by one game of speech, it is too simple and too violent, this player spent 5 years in this game, there have been hundreds of thousands of games, he must also bring another player with happy game experience,
Why does Riot deny all of him according to one game? Isn't this a huge problem in the system itself? If it is a real social problem, can you negate all of him because of his words while he is angry ï¼Ÿ Then why should those who intentionally feed did not get more serious punishments? If a victory is not a result of a key game, what are we fighting for and what we are trying to do in the same game with a group of people who do not know?

We don't know he was perma banned, he only mentioned a ban, which could just as easily refer to a chat ban (the lowest punishment tier). It's also worth noting that while we have freedom of speech, that doesn't mean we have freedom from consequence. Riot chooses to make the consequence of being an ass restriction from the game in one manner or another. They have the right to do that, just as we have the right to say we don't like it and take our time elsewhere.

Freedom of speech also doesn't protect hate speech and hasn't for a very long time.

It doesn't matter who started it because both will be judged on their behaviour. Little Timmy throwing a rock and Bob on the playground doesn't mean that Bob throwing a rock back is ok.

Gameplay offences skip you straight to a 14 day ban (one step before permanent), while chat offences typically get two chat restrictions before that. Gameplay offences like intentionally feeding are punished harsher, just slower because of the limitations of the system. It's not ideal, but not being able to punish one behaviour instantly shouldn't mean that other behaviours are ignored.

You are right but I just told that is not good that can do better. In fact chat offences can lead to permanent ban, I think this is not right and it can not make the game better sometimes it is also unfair, but just like u said if we don't like it we can spend our times on other things, but I guess it feels bad to giving up a game that has already played for years. And it's not a good thing for Riot to lose these loyal players.

I think we'll have to agree to disagree then. In my opinion, if a chat restriction isn't getting the message across then escalate it. You get plenty of warnings for toxicity before perma ban. Toxicity hurts more players than Riot would ever lose by removing those that are toxic.

One of Riots priorities right now should really be improving the punishment system. There are way too many toxic/troll players who just need to be removed, maybe if Riot doesnt want to ban them then they should make a toxic player only server where people get moved based on their actions.

There's been talk in the past of a prisoner's island kinda deal, and it's been suggested many times since, but in the end it just didn't line up with their values, and since it isn't something that's really effective as anything except a ban anyway, it'd be a waste of resources when you can just ban the account normally.

As for improving the punishment system, I agree. The system is way to slow to punish gameplay offences, even some of the more obvious intent feeders still get away with it for far longer than is ok. It does a pretty good job for chat but gameplay offences are definitely a weak point.

I assume you would fire back when  you hear someone insulting you with "fk u..." or something else while you are walking on streets, so would I. Likewise, in the game, only people who can always tolerate that or choose to block bad teammates can avoid being involved into a quarrel. Unfortunately, I can't tolerate. 

And, without those initiators, there wont be any argument in a game, I wont be banned neither.

However, this is called self-defense in law, like defense when you are attacked by someone intentionally.

One man's behavior can be changed by other people, one player always following rules can also say bad words with troll players, then you say they are all bad. I don't think that's reasonable.

The punishment should really  put on those troll initiator, who intentionally disrespect others, who intentionally ruin the game for his bad mood about other things.

Anyway, it's none of my business anymore.

There's a difference between defending yourself and abusing them back. This also isn't a one on one situation. If you just mute them nothing comes of it beyond them being punished, but if you fire back you make things worse for yourself and for *everyone else on your team*.

It's not a case of you being punished and the other guy not. It's a case of you both being punished according to your own behaviour. A kid throwing a rock at another on the playground doesn't make it ok for kid 2 to throw one back, they both get in trouble for that.

Sry I dont agree your opinion. This is not a story about kids,  players are not 'good boys' in school following the teachers, they are people in society.

This is just about mutual respect and personal benefit.

We play, we cooperate, we win, we have fun. In this process, we have mutual respect, then we could have fun.

Troll destroys this process and damages other people's benefit.

In real society, we have the right and freedom the fire back when attacked, this is not childishness. In other words, he already disrespected me, ruined this game, destroyed this game's fun for me, why would I be a 'polite person ' to him.  Players are normal people not sages. 

In your way which is muting others, I can only see escape. Conflict will always exist in  this way coz troll wont be punished and what's more possible is the interfered players will do bad and enjoy a shit game.  Troll will be more confident and bolder coz no one says no to their offensive behavior for no reason.

I think this may be a bit improper, we couldn't rely on polices to defense all the mobs, but ourselves coz polices may not that capable. Mobs need to be restricted with some kind of action. But the people fighting against them are not supposed to be treated as mobs, right?

If it was two adults throwing adult sized rocks at each other then, is that not assault?

Again, this isn't *one on one*. If you don't engage the trolls get bored. If you engage you've given them fuel for the fire. You fire back and you just make it 10x worse. The whole while you're dragging your whole team through all this, when you could instead just be getting on with the game. You think they want that? You think that helps you to win or have a good experience?

Noone is saying you have to be polite or respectful to him, but abusing them makes you just as bad, and dragging other entirely innocent players into a toxic shitfest because you couldn't just ignore or mute him? How is that fair?

Muting is an escape yes, that's the whole point. If you have to mute someone the damage is already done, so report them, and they will be punished accordingly.

And the mob argument? Vigilantes are criminals as well you realise? If you go out and murder a guy just because he was a member of a mob, that's still murder.

You also failed to post your chat logs. If you really thought your logs weren't worthy of a punishment why not post them? Not to mention if you've been perma banned for chat you've had *at least* one warning prior that your behaviour was not ok.

If nothing else, you were made aware of the rules of the community, and still chose to ignore them.

1. No matter how big the rocks are, the one attacked by intentional damage has reason to fire back, this is rule in society, do not say you do not know! 

2. Yes, I failed to mute troll people coz I got mad for intentional offensive behavior, so all engaged should be punished. However, why initiator is still active.

3. Mob? U dont go out to kill mob, u fight or kill when they want to kill u, not for no reason, that's what a troll does.

4.I can get the whole chat logs including all teammates', that would be pointless only with my chat record. BTW, I could reinstall game for getting my own chat records, but then what? those troll will be punished? NO ! so why bother.

5.Your so-called rules are not the same as what in society, in real life.

I wont continue discussing this right or wrong, or 'throwing rocks'. 

Anyways, u r rule makers of this game, u govern this game, its right when you say it is right.

Yes, your system is indeed simple. Reported -> banned. Analysis? Judgment? Never mind. You don't do this coz you don't have time and resource to do such a huge task. You just make it as simple as you can complete, understandable.

I got P banned, thats why I said bye to this game.

We play for fun, but if someone is toxic to you, there's no fun in this game anymore, why would I continue suffering someone's troll?

Can I quit? no, I couldn't do that to other teammates. 

Can I fire back? no, coz I will be reported and this is ' not right' according to your words. 

Then what? I continue suffering his troll, and then the guy gets bolder and crazier. 

This is not what we want and I fired back coz I was mad about the troll. People fire back when they are attacked.
I can't be more unsatisfied about this system. If I got banned for firing back, then those initiators and people who are toxic in game would also be banned, then troll will be eliminated soon. But the truth is not what we expect, initiators and trolls are still active. That's why people encounter troll all the time.  Coz this system is not sound, and your rules are not reasonable.

It does matter who started first. Be realistic. If the Germany invaded neighbour country, and started the World War, then it's their fault. If Trump started a racial problem, then it's his fault. If other players wish my mom to die from cancer, then it's their fault, that i said something back. If Riot does not understand this, then they should not be punishing any players. Ask yourself this, why that toxic behaviour on a rise? Why has Riot System doesn't seems to be effective?

Repost (because the truth hurt first time apparently):

Riot doesnt care about its player base and would rather keep people ruining the game in, and boot people who wanna see it improve.

The only thing i have to say about controlling toxic players is to let them mute themselves. I used to have this problem where I'd flame everyone for no reason and I was coping chat restrictions all the time. Back then I wish I could mute myself so i didnt get banned, but alas its been 3 seasons since i've been chat banned. #reformed
